description: , hereOccasionally issues of journals where one might not normally think to look produce thematic issues of interest. Availability online makes them much more discoverable. A case in point: RCC Perspectives (Rachel Carson Center for Environment and Society). , hereOccasionally issues of journals where one might not normally think to look produce thematic issues of interest. Availability online makes them much more discoverable. A case in point: RCC Perspectives (Rachel Carson Center for Environment and Society). 2012/03:  Sickness, Hunger, War, and Religion: Multidisciplinary Perspectives, Edited by Michaela Harbeck, Kristin von Heyking, and Heiner Schwarzberg.
title: RCC Perspectives (Rachel Carson Center for Environment and Society)
